newsitem.title: BULGARIA: Bulgaria lev closes flat at 490-500 per dollar.
newsitem.headline: Bulgaria lev closes flat at 490-500 per dollar.

text.p: The Bulgarian lev closed at 490-500 per dollar, little changed from 495-500 in the morning but down from the previous close of 473-475 due to longer value date of spot deals, dealers said.
"Trade was balanced today as banks and clients were bidding for low (dollar) volumes for short-covering or pending payments," a commercial bank dealer said.
The BNB was seen buying dollars near 487 levs in the morning to boost its foreign exchange reserves, traders said.
Central bank officials were not available for comment. @
The lev eased from Wednesday's close due to the longer value date of today's spot deals, which falls on Friday, December 27, another dealer said.
Markets will be closed in Bulgaria from Monday through Thursday for Christmas holidays.
The current large spread between interest rates of dollar- and lev-denominated deposits allows for a daily lev drop of some two levs per dollar under the current main interest rate, dealers said.
The rate is now set at 15 percent monthly or 180 percent annually by the Bulgarian National Bank (BNB). @
BNB's forex reserves stood at $525 million at the end of November, down from $541 million a month earlier. -- Sofia Newsroom, 359-2-876032
